creator: Dawson, Simon James, 1820-1902. (author)
Taché, Alexandre-Antonin, 1823-1894. (author)
description: Dawson, Simon James: 1820-1902. Civil engineer; appointed to survey the country west of Lake Superior, 1857; employed in the opening up of the Dawson Route, 1868; superintended transportation of troops in Red River expedition, 1870 (Wallace, Dictionary of Canadian biography). // Taché, Alexandre-Antonin: 1823-1894. Arrived in Red River as a Catholic missionary, 1845; coadjutor bishop of Saint-Boniface, 1851; succeeded Bishop Provencher, 1853; created archbishop, 1871; acted as a mediator during Red River Rebellion; prominent participant in the dispute over Manitoba separate schools in the early 1890s (Wallace, Dictionary of Canadian biography). // For English version, see Peel 361.
format: 47 p., fold. maps, fold. plan.; 32 cm.
subject: Canada--Politics and government
Discoveries in geography
Découvertes géographiques
Red River Valley (Man.)--Description and travel
title: Rapport sur l'exploration de la contrée entre le lac Supérieur et la colonie de la rivière Rouge, et entre ce dernier endroit et les rivières Assiniboine et Saskatchewan
